metadata.synopsis: Volo is a canonical character in DnD. He's known for being the realm's go-to guy for compiling information. In this take, he fulfils that role but puts a twist on what he sees. He's keenly curious for facts but likes to embellish them. A bit like Gilderoy Lockheart. He IS talented, but his reputation has gotten away from him, too. In this dialogue, Volo will offer to put his knowledge at your service if you confide you've been infected with a mindflayer. He'll perform an icepick lobotomy that'll leave you without an eye or much in the way of apology from Volo. He should be clever, a little arrogant, very English, and very fun, without being a cartoon character.

42.speaker: Volo
42.text: Quite the cosy set-up you have here. I'll just make myself comfortable - thank you so much.

97.speaker: Volo
97.text: I was just settling in and reviewing my latest findings. Mind flayers, cultists, and of course, your esteemed company!

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Has your research turned up anything that might help with this parasite problem?

81.speaker: Volo
81.text: Not yet, I'm afraid. But my expectations are very, very high!

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I want help with my parasite. By any means necessary.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: What do you know about mind flayers?

70.speaker: Volo
70.text: Why, I'm practically an expert. They've tentacles, you know. Quite shocking.

195.speaker: Volo
195.text: The druid Halsin had some kind of mind flayer specimen in a jar in his quarters. A replica, no doubt, but truly fascinating to see up close.

24.speaker: Volo
24.text: Here?! On the Sword Coast? Impossible.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Not only have I encountered a mind flayer, I've killed one.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: I was captured by mind flayers before. I'm lucky to be alive.

130.speaker: Volo
130.text: Tell me: have you noticed any residual psionic malaise since the alleged encounter?

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I have. And the mind flayer infected me with a parasite.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Malaise is one word for it. More like... psychic transference?

99.speaker: Volo
99.text: Illithids - their technical name - form a hivemind. One shouldn't be able to hear their dark whispers... unless...

74.speaker: Player
74.text: ...Unless you've been infected with one of their parasites.

153.speaker: Volo
153.text: Hm. Are you familiar with the process of ceremorphosis? That is - what happens when a mind flayer parasite infects a living host.

77.speaker: Volo
77.text: I can't attest to the specifics. But I do know that not long after insertion, the host (that's you) turns into a mind flayer.

65.speaker: Volo
65.text: As there's not a tentacle on your head, I can only assume you haven't been infected.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: No. Haven't noticed anything like that.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I killed a mind flayer in its lair, aboard a nautiloid.

87.speaker: Volo
87.text: You're either an excellent storyteller... or you've experienced something quite exceptional.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I've also been infected with one of their parasites.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: A mind flayer planted one of their larvae in my brain.

181.speaker: Volo
181.text: That's quite impossible. You'd have undergone ceremorphosis by now.

83.speaker: Volo
83.text: I can't attest to the specifics. But I do know that not long after insertion, the host (that's you) turns into a mind flayer.

117.speaker: Volo
117.text: As there's not a tentacle on your head, I can only assume you haven't been infected.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: If only your disbelief could alter facts.

25.speaker: Volo
25.text: If what you say were true, you'd be a mind flayer by now.

154.speaker: Volo
154.text: You. Infected by a mind flayer. It's ridiculous...

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Examine me. Find out for yourself.

50.speaker: Volo
50.text: Perhaps that's for the best. I'd be irresponsible not to debunk such a strange claim.

198.speaker: Volo
198.text: If I just peer in your eye, I could quickly...
198.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Volo directs the player character to the bed by his side and has them lie down

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I want rid of this thing by any means necessary.

128.speaker: Volo
128.text: If we managed it, we'd have a specimen of incredible rarity on our hands.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Quit the shouting. Can you help?

15.speaker: Volo
15.text: I... I mean... I mean yes, I suppose I can.

0.speaker: Volo
0.text: I'll need to research the particulars, however. Give me a bit of time, and I'll have this little issue sorted.

110.speaker: Volo
110.text: My research turned up a rather brilliant technique that seems quite actionable.

171.speaker: Volo
171.text: It's not too deep. Just behind the orbital socket. I could attempt an extraction. I've a needle in my tunic, after all...

10.speaker: Volo
10.text: The creature's in your brain, somewhere behind the orbital socket. I could attempt to remove it. I've a needle in my tunic...

156.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Volo pulls out a needle
~Volo hovers over the player holding a needle by their eye

137.speaker: Player
137.text: How many times have you done this before?

150.speaker: Volo
150.text: I assure you, I've dreamt of it a thousand times over.

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *Volo carefully holds one of your eyes open and begins to prod uncertainly with the needle.*
22.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Volo holds the players right eye open with his left hand carefully prods the needle with his right hand into the eye.
~Needle prodding idle

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Endure the discomfort. Let him carry on.

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *The needle finds the gap between eyeball and socket. Volo frowns and begins to push.*

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Pain shoots through your body as the needle snags on your optic nerve.*

197.speaker: Narrator
197.text: *The needle see-saws back and forth, plucking the nerve like a harp string.*

208.speaker: Volo
208.text: Oh bother. There's some obstacle in the way. I shall need a more robust implement.

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: *Volo carefully withdraws the needle from your eye. Then, reaching into his bag, he produces an ice pick.*
116.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Volo removes the needle, turns away from the player, takes out an ice pick, and hovers over their face again
~Volo hovers over the player holding an ice pick by their eye, reverse grip

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Eye the implement, but allow him to proceed.

186.speaker: Narrator
186.text: *Volo slowly brings the ice pick closer to your eye.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *Cold metal presses against the skin beneath your brow, and then...*
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Volo slides the icepick into the player's eye socket

68.speaker: Narrator
68.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Then taps it twice gently, before pressing down with his body
~Volo roots around the player's eye socket with the ice pick (long idle)

35.speaker: Volo
35.text: Do you feel that? I believe we have the blighter on the run!

60.speaker: Volo
60.text: I agree! It's a feisty critter. Just... a little... further...

190.speaker: Narrator
190.text: *Volo tears the pick from your brain with a violent jerk; your eye plops down into the mud.*
190.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Volo taps the icepick even deeper and the players eye pops out of the socket, rolling into the mud

188.speaker: Narrator
188.text: *He pauses, looks down at your eye, and recoils slightly as it sinks into the mud.*

123.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player rolls over limply, revealing the empty eye socket, then passes out

5.speaker: Volo
5.text: There appears to be an amount of... cosmetic damage.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player wakes with Volo helping them sit up, the player touches their face (idle)

206.speaker: Player
206.text: YOU KNOCKED MY BLOODY EYE OUT!

107.speaker: Volo
107.text: Please, try not to overexert yourself. You're in a rather fragile state at present.

91.speaker: Volo
91.text: Oh. Fantastic! That squint does wonders for your gravitas, in my humble opinion.

146.speaker: Volo
146.text: Though, erm, perhaps there's something we can do...

211.speaker: Player
211.text: I can't seem to see through one of my eyes.

45.speaker: Volo
45.text: Yes, quite. There is some... mild trauma.

11.speaker: Volo
11.text: I can't help but feel partly responsible. Perhaps there's something more I can do...

175.context: InternalNodeContext: ~Volo hands the player a fake eye

134.speaker: Volo
134.text: Take this. A far superior relic to that old jelly you were chained to.

106.speaker: Volo
106.text: Try it on for size. And, erm, it was... very nice to have met you.

36.speaker: Volo
36.text: I'm sure you'll sort out your little brain problem one way or another. Far away from here, if you've a heart.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Looks like I'm going to need to find help elsewhere...

54.speaker: Volo
54.text: Perhaps you should visit a healer? You could have them check on your eye at the same time.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: Stop. This is never going to work.

214.speaker: Volo
214.text: Are you sure? If I don't intervene, the parasite will continue to gestate inside you.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I don't have much choice then. Fine, continue.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: No, no. This is too much. Knock it off.

119.speaker: Volo
119.text: Are you certain? We're nearly there...

13.speaker: Volo
13.text: As you wish. But when your skin starts to peel away, remember - Volo offered to help.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: That obstacle is my eye. Stop at once.

28.speaker: Volo
28.text: Regrettable. Mark my words - ceremorphosis will be far more painful than this procedure!

58.speaker: Volo
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Volo holds the players right eye open with his left hand carefully prods the needle with his right hand into the eye. [reuse]

166.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Player Stumbles off the exam table and walks away, shot neutral so it can come from different exam table states

78.speaker: Volo
78.text: As you wish, my friend. When the transformation occurs, I can only hope you are far away from me!

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Do you have the faintest idea of what you're doing?

163.speaker: Volo
163.text: Don't fidget! The needle must slip behind your eye, not through it!

46.speaker: Player
46.text: This parasite is unusual. I have it on good authority that extraction is currently impossible.

200.speaker: Volo
200.text: You won't find a more learned opinion on this matter, I assure you.

212.speaker: Volo
212.text: You only have a matter of days to live. Don't dally, my friend.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: This parasite is unusual. I have it on good authority that extraction is currently impossible.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: I'd rather get a second opinion.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: No - I only have one good eye left.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Sorry, but I have no eyes left to spare.

142.speaker: Volo
142.text: Still... there'd be no harm in my taking a teensy look, would there? I know all the signs...

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Doubts aside, you should keep your distance from me.

56.speaker: Volo
56.text: Hrm. I'd be irresponsible not to debunk such a strange claim.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I don't want you poking around in my head.

148.speaker: Volo
148.text: As you wish. But I'd be quite careful to whom I go spreading such rumours.

76.speaker: Volo
76.text: Ridiculous though such a claim may be, a mind flayer is a terrible thing to be.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: And their parasites? Do you know anything about them?

98.speaker: Volo
98.text: As a matter of fact, I do. But why do you?

129.speaker: Player
129.text: How did you find the camp?

184.speaker: Volo
184.text: Finding is my job, my friend. If there's anything in the world worth knowing, I assure you, I do.

101.speaker: Volo
101.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

9.speaker: Volo
9.text: Once I've written you into one of my books, there won't be a tavern in Faerûn you can enter without receiving a hero's welcome.

112.speaker: Volo
112.text: My friend! How do you fare?

159.speaker: Narrator
159.text: *He taps the pick and your eye springs from its socket, dangling wetly on your cheek.*
159.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Volo taps the icepick even deeper and the players eye pops out of the socket. Player freezes in shock.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: You're very responsible, so speak up.

59.speaker: Volo
59.text: Take this. A far superior relic to that old jelly you were chained to.

183.speaker: Volo
183.text: Hm. I... seem to have misplaced it. It was a fine bauble, a replacement for your eye.

189.speaker: Volo
189.text: Have it your own way! The important thing is we've learned a great deal about these parasites.

158.speaker: Volo
158.text: Specifically, how not to extract them.

140.speaker: Volo
140.text: I must depart soon, but I insist you take this. You'll thank me when you try it on for size.
